titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the first half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the first half of the year (fols. 2ra-181vb) I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 2ra – 30vc) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 31ra – 55rc) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 55va – 82va) I-4) Taḫśaś (fols. 83ra –115vc) I-5) Ṭǝrr (fols. 116ra – 155vb) I-6) Yäkkatit (fols. 156ra – 181vb) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor:
The name of the original donor is Laʿǝkä Maryam, mentioned in supplication formulas throughout the Ms. and in Additio 1. His wife Fǝśśǝḥa Maryam (e.g., fols. 16vc, 36ra, 112rab, 156vc) as well as one of their children, Ğǝr Wäsän (e.g., fols. 46va, 49vb) are also mentioned in supplication formulas and in Additio 1.
From fol. 2r to 35rc the names of the original donors have been erased and mostly replaced with that of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus. Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus is the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831).

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 18th cent.(?) The replacement of the name of the original donor with that of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus/däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831) hints that the Ms. was written at least in the late 18th cent.

txstates.txstate: Fol. 10 slightly damaged at the edge. Holes and tears carefully amended on fols. 92, 103, 119, 141, 143, 150, 162, 174.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with deep rose tooled leather (remains of probably original, dark brown tooled leather cover are preserved on the inner side of both boards). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the older dark brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: x-form, double circle, dots, crescent, double line fillet, scored hatching). Blind tooled ornament on the deep rose leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, dice, small x, double crescent with eye),

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

txfolios.txfolio: 182+1; the leaf after fol. 144, was not foliated; it has been given number 144a.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(10/fols. 74r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 107r-115v) – XV(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVI(8/fols. 124r-131v) – XVII(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XVIII (8/fols. 140r-146v) – XIX(8/fols. 147r-155v) – XX (8/fols. 156r-163v) – XXI(8/fols. 164r-171v) – XXII(11; s.l.: 11, stub before 1/fols. 172r-182v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Black inks of different tones and pens with differently shaped nibs were used for writing (e.g., pen with a broad nib on fol. 75r; with a thin nib on fol. 147r). The handwriting, though not necessarily belonging to more than one scribe, shows some changes (also on one and the same fol. e.g., 116r, 139r), cp. slightly sloping letters with big loops (fol. 75r), and more widely spaced letters elsewhere. The handwriting is similar to that attested in Ms. QS-008. It is very similar though not identical to the hand of the Synaxarion from the church of ʿArbaʿtu Ǝnsäsa, ʿArabay, Tämben. The names of the original donors are crudely replaced with the name Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (most probably by hand that did the same in QS-008).

rubrications.rubrication:
Rubrication is executed in red and crimson in varying tones by different scribes.
Nomina sacra; names of the donors; incipit of each commemorative notice; the word sälam "salutation"; a few other words (e.g., fols. 4rc, 15rc, 21rb, 30ra, 43ra, 54ra, 61ra, 113vc); names of the months in the upper margin of some fols; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs (e.g., nine dot asterisks separating the commemorative notices: fols. 14va, 40vc, 60va, 81vc, 104vc, 146rc; chains of red and black dots at the end of each month: e.g., fols. 30vc, 55rc, 82va, 115vc, 155vb, 181vc).
Several lines or groups of lines on the page opening the commemorative notices for each month are rubricated: six red lines above in groups of two, alternating with black lines and two red lines below (fols. 2r, 31r, 55v, 83r, 116r, 156r).

otherdetails.otherdetail: For the second half of the Sǝnkǝssar see Ms. QS-008.

additional.cont: Fol. 30vc: Zä-ˀaqräbku maḫletä… “The song I am offering…” (concluding prayer).
additional.det: Unfinished. Written in black and red ink. The text is repeated on fols. 181vc-182ra in ink (?), but is hardly legible due to faded ink. The very beginning is overwritten with a pen.

additional.tran: Fol. 181va: This is the book of Laˁǝkä Maryam <...> and his father Dǝbbus ˀƎgziˀ and his mother Wälättä Qwǝnabän and his wife Fǝśśǝḥa Maryam and his children Ğǝr Wäsän, Yabḥa ˀƎgziˀ, Säbänä Giyorgis, Ḫadärä Maryam. May the Lord have compassion on them with the prayer of all righteous and martyrs, through the prayer of our Lady Mary the Mother of God. Amen. The one who stole it or erased it or mistreated it shall be excommunicated like Arius.

extras.extra: - On fols. 2r-35rc the names of the original donors are crudely replaced with the name of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus; most probably by the hand that did the same in Ms. QS-008. - Corrections over erased words and passages and interlineally: e.g., fols. 44vb, 86vc, 89ra, 112ra, 113vc, 126vb, 129ra. - Erased note (?) in the upper margin of fol. 51v. - Erasures marked with crossing or parallel lines: e.g., fols. 34vc, 116rc, 117vb, 141rc, 165ra. - Erasures without marking: e.g., fols. 93rb, 97va, 131vb. - Crude drawings, scribbels in pen and pencil: e.g., fols. 1r, 1v, 8r, 50r, 51r, 158v,176v, 181vc.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The names of the months are written in the upper margin of some fols. (the black ink is of a different tone): ወርኀ መስከረም ቡሩክ(?): fol. 2r ወርኀ ጥቅምት ቡሩክ: fol. 31r ወርኀ ኅዳር ቡሩክ: fol. 55v ዝንቱ ወርኀ ታኅሣሥ: fol. 83r ወርኀ ጥር: fol. 116r ወርኀ የካቲት: fol. 156r. All names are encircled with a red line (fols. 2r, 31r) or with red dots (fols. 55v, 156r) or with black dots (fol. 83r).

frames.frame: Fols. 30vc, 55ra, 155vb: simple ornamental bands (red and black); geometric motifs.
